JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Margarita Tsatsa-Nikolovska;Mark Villiger;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Snejana Botoucharova;Volodymyr Butkevych
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP and NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . He was represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , from ORG . The Government of GPE did not make use of their right to intervene ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Convention ) .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant ’s parents owned a house with land in GPE CARDINAL . In DATE the whole family failed to return from a stay in GPE and remained abroad without the consent of the NORP authorities . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , ORG ( obvodní soud ) convicted in absentia the applicant ’s father , his mother and himself of deserting the Republic ( opuštění republiky ) , sentenced them to imprisonment and ordered the confiscation of all their property . On DATE the house was sold by the NORP State to PERSON and PERSON , with the right to use the land .

On DATE the applicant ’s father filed an action for the restitution of the confiscated property , pursuant to ORG , against PERSON and her daughter . On DATE he died . The rights of the applicant and his mother over his estate were confirmed in inheritance proceedings .
On DATE CARDINAL of the defendants died . On DATE ORG stayed the restitution proceedings pending the outcome of inheritance proceedings . On DATE the inheritance proceedings were closed .

On DATE ORG resumed the restitution proceedings . On DATE the court decided that the applicant could continue with the restitution case alone , his mother having died on DATE . After joining the restitution proceedings , the applicant learnt that he had been adopted DATE after his birth and that his biological parents had been of NORP origin . He also discovered that his adoptive mother had been tortured in NORP concentration camps and that , as a consequence , she could not have children . According to the applicant , this news caused him enormous mental suffering and distress .
In a judgment of DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s restitution action .
On DATE ORG ( městský soud ) upheld this judgment in respect of the merits , but quashed ORG decision concerning the court fees and returned this matter to ORG for further consideration .
It appears that the restitution proceedings are still pending .

The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the allegedly excessive length of judicial proceedings are set out in the ORG ’s decision in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . MONEY ( dec . ) , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , DATE ) .
